prompt: Statement: 'Buy our soap for clear skin' - An advertisement. Assumptions: I. Clear skin is desirable. II. The soap provides clear skin.
explanation: Ad assumes people want clear skin (I) and soap delivers it (II). Both are assumed.

prompt: Statement: Please switch off fans when leaving the room. Assumptions: I. Fans consume electricity. II. Electricity should be conserved.
explanation: Request assumes fans use electricity (I) and conservation is important (II).

prompt: Statement: Join our coaching for guaranteed success. Assumptions: I. Success can be guaranteed. II. Coaching helps in success.
explanation: Statement assumes success can be guaranteed (I) and coaching contributes to it (II).

prompt: Statement: Apply early as seats are limited. Assumptions: I. Many people will apply. II. Applications will be processed in order.
explanation: Warning implies high demand (I) and first-come-first-served (II).

prompt: Statement: Read the manual before operating the machine. Assumptions: I. Manual contains operating instructions. II. Machine is complex to operate.
explanation: Assumes manual has instructions (I). Complexity not necessarily assumed (II uncertain).

prompt: Statement: Drink boiled water to prevent diseases. Assumptions: I. Boiling kills germs. II. Unboiled water may cause diseases.
explanation: Statement assumes boiling purifies (I) and unboiled water is risky (II).

prompt: Statement: Work hard and you will succeed. Assumptions: I. Success is achievable through hard work. II. Hard work is under one's control.
explanation: Assumes hard work leads to success (I) and people can choose to work hard (II).

prompt: Statement: Medicines should be kept away from children. Assumptions: I. Children may consume medicines accidentally. II. Medicines can be harmful if misused.
explanation: Warning assumes children might access medicines (I) and misuse is dangerous (II).

prompt: Statement: Wear helmet while riding two-wheeler. Assumptions: I. Helmet provides safety. II. Accidents can happen.
explanation: Assumes helmet protects (I) and accidents are possible (II).

prompt: Statement: All employees must carry ID cards. Assumptions: I. ID cards help in identification. II. Some people without ID may enter.
explanation: Rule assumes ID helps identify (I) and prevents unauthorized entry (II).

prompt: Statement: Do not use mobile while driving. Assumptions: I. Mobile use distracts drivers. II. Distraction can cause accidents.
explanation: Warning assumes mobile distracts (I) and distraction is dangerous (II).

prompt: Statement: Attend the seminar for career growth. Assumptions: I. Seminar provides useful knowledge. II. Career growth is desirable.
explanation: Statement assumes seminar is beneficial (I) and people want career growth (II).

prompt: Statement: Register before the deadline to avoid penalty. Assumptions: I. Late registration incurs penalty. II. People don't want to pay penalty.
explanation: Assumes penalty for late registration (I) and people prefer to avoid it (II).

prompt: Statement: Bring original documents for verification. Assumptions: I. Verification requires original documents. II. Photocopies may not be accepted.
explanation: Assumes originals needed for verification (I) and copies might not suffice (II).

prompt: Statement: Practice daily for better results. Assumptions: I. Practice improves performance. II. Better results are desired.
explanation: Assumes practice helps (I) and people want better results (II).
